message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class MatrixReader {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("matrix.txt"));
            List<String[]> rows = new ArrayList<String[]>();
            String line;
            while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
                StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line, " ");
                String[] row = new String[st.countTokens()];
                int i = 0;
                while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                    row[i] = st.nextToken();
                    i++;
                }
                rows.add(row);
            }
            br.close();

            System.out.println(rows.toString());
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we use the BufferedReader class to read the matrix.txt file line by line. For each line, we create a new StringTokenizer object with the line and the space (" ") delimiter. We then create a new String array with the size equal to the number of tokens in the line. We use a while loop to iterate through the tokens and store them in the array. Finally, we add the array to the list of rows. After reading all the lines, we print the rows list.
